00035 // Default port. Assumes one BMS plugged in
00036 // and no other USB devices posing as serial
00037 // devices.
00038 #define SERIAL_PORT "/dev/ttyUSB0"
00039 
00040 // The number below is size of the longest possible response
00041 // received from the QSB when all terminators are on and spaces
00042 // separate the elements. It also allows for the string termination.
00043 const int BUFFER_SIZE = 100;
00044 
00045 // The USB link between the QSB and the computer introduces
00046 // considerable lag. So, we need to wait a bit when sending
00047 // an instruction before we get the response. The value of
00048 // 5 ms is empirical and may need adjustment on other systems.
00049 const int FIVE_MILLISECONDS = 50000;
00050 
00051 // How many times we will try a non-blocking read of the
00052 // device before we call it a failed operation.
00053 const int MAX_READ_TRIES = 20;
00054 
00055 // Rather than getting into complications reading the
00056 // keyboard for input, we will just trap Ctrl+C and
00057 // notify the app when the user is done.
00058 int CloseRequested = FALSE;
00059 
00060 int bms;
00061 
00062 void printBMSError(char* errorMessage)
00063 {
00064         printf("%s: %d - %s", errorMessage, errno, strerror(errno));
00065         exit(-1);
00066 }
00067 
00068 // The QSB presents itself to the system as a vanilla
00069 // UART and we can talk to it using the standard
00070 // POSIX IO functions.
00071 //
00072 // In the two utilitarian functions below, 'qsb' is
00073 // a standard UNIX file handle pointing to the serial
00074 // port where the devices is hosted.
00075 
00076 
00077 void sendBMSInstruction(int bms, char* command)
00078 {
00079     // Create a padded instruction string that includes
00080     // CR+LF. The QSB will be happy with just CR or LF too.
00081     char* bmsCommand = (char *)malloc(strlen(command) + 1);
00082     sprintf(bmsCommand, "%s\r", command);
00083 
00084     int ioResult = write(bms, bmsCommand, strlen(bmsCommand));
00085     free(bmsCommand);
00086 
00087     if (ioResult < 0)
00088     {
00089         printBMSError("Error writing to BMS device");
00090     }
00091 }
00092 
00093 
00094 void readBMSResponse(int bms, char* response, int responseSize)
00095 {
00096     int i = 0;
00097     int ioResult;
00098     usleep(FIVE_MILLISECONDS);
00099     read(bms, response, responseSize);
00100     usleep(FIVE_MILLISECONDS);
00101 
00102     if (i == MAX_READ_TRIES)
00103     {
00104         printBMSError("Error reading from BMS device - Max Tries");
00105     }
00106 
00107     // Remove the trailing CR+LF if any, and trim to proper size.
00108     int end = strcspn(response, "\r\n");
00109     response[end] = '\0';
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 // Every instruction sent to the QSB is acknowledged
00114 // with a corresponding response string. We then send
00115 // the instruction and retrieve the response as a
00116 // single command transaction.
00117 void bmsCommand(int bms, char* command, char* response, int responseSize)
00118 {
00119     sendBMSInstruction(bms, command);
00120     readBMSResponse(bms, response, responseSize);
00121 }

00124 
00125 void ctrlCHandler(int signal)
00126 {
00127          close(bms);
00128          exit(1);
00129 }

00132 float getVoltage(int node){
00133         char voltage[BUFFER_SIZE];
00134         string voltString;
00135         switch (node){
00136         case 0:
00137                 bmsCommand(bms, "01querytot", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00138                 voltString=voltage;
00139                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00140                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00141                 break;
00142         case 1:
00143                 bmsCommand(bms, "01voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00144                 voltString=voltage;
00145                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00146                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00147                 break;
00148         case 2:
00149                 bmsCommand(bms, "02voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00150                 voltString=voltage;
00151                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00152                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00153                 break;
00154         case 3:
00155                 bmsCommand(bms, "03voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00156                 voltString=voltage;
00157                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00158                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00159                 break;
00160         case 4:
00161                 bmsCommand(bms, "04voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00162                 voltString=voltage;
00163                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00164                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00165                 break;
00166         case 5:
00167                 bmsCommand(bms, "05voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00168                 voltString=voltage;
00169                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00170                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00171                 break;
00172         case 6:
00173                 bmsCommand(bms, "06voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00174                 voltString=voltage;
00175                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00176                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00177                 break;
00178         case 7:
00179                 bmsCommand(bms, "07voltage", voltage, BUFFER_SIZE);
00180                 voltString=voltage;
00181                 voltString.erase(0,4);
00182                 return strtod(voltString.c_str(),NULL);
00183                 break;
00184         default:
00185                 break;
00186         }
00187 }
00188 
00189 float getTemperature(int node){
00190         char temperature[BUFFER_SIZE];
00191         string temperatureString;
00192         switch (node){
00193         case 0:
00194                 bmsCommand(bms, "01temperat", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00195                 temperatureString=temperature;
00196                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00197                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00198                 break;
00199         case 1:
00200                 bmsCommand(bms, "01xtrntemp", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00201                 temperatureString=temperature;
00202                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00203                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00204                 break;
00205         case 2:
00206                 bmsCommand(bms, "02xtrntemp", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00207                 temperatureString=temperature;
00208                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00209                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00210                 break;
00211         case 3:
00212                 bmsCommand(bms, "03xtrntemp", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00213                 temperatureString=temperature;
00214                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00215                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00216                 break;
00217         case 4:
00218                 bmsCommand(bms, "04xtrntemp", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00219                 temperatureString=temperature;
00220                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00221                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00222                 break;
00223         case 5:
00224                 bmsCommand(bms, "05xtrntemp", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00225                 temperatureString=temperature;
00226                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00227                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00228                 break;
00229         case 6:
00230                 bmsCommand(bms, "06xtrntemp", temperature, BUFFER_SIZE);
00231                 temperatureString=temperature;
00232                 temperatureString.erase(0,4);
00233                 return strtod(temperatureString.c_str(),NULL);
00234                 break;
00235         default:
00236                 break;
00237         }
00238 }
00239 
00240 void configureBMS(std::string port){
00241         // Open the port.  If a port is passed as parameter use that otherwise use the default one /dev/ttyUSB0
00242 
00243             for( int i=0; i<50;i++){
00244                 bms = open(port.c_str(), O_RDWR | O_NOCTTY | O_NONBLOCK);
00245                 if(bms>=0) break;
00246                 usleep(100000);
00247                         ROS_ERROR_STREAM("Could Not Open BMS. Retrying...");
00248             }
00249             if (bms < 0)
00250             {
00251                 ROS_ERROR_STREAM("Error opening BMS device");
00252                 exit(0);
00253             }
00254 
00255 
00256             // Configure it.
00257             struct termios bmsConfiguration;
00258             tcgetattr(bms, &bmsConfiguration);
00259 
00260             // Baud 9600 and 8 Bit, 1 Stop Bit, No-Parity
00261             bmsConfiguration.c_cflag = B9600 | CS8;
00262             //fcntl(bms, F_SETFL, 200);
00263             cfsetospeed(&bmsConfiguration, B9600);
00264             // Flush immediately
00265             tcflush(bms, TCIFLUSH);
00266             // Change attributes now
00267             tcsetattr(bms, TCSAFLUSH, &bmsConfiguration);
00268 
00269             // Below is the basic communications protocol with
00270             // the QSB. The commands were composed using the
00271             // QSB command list available for download at the
00272             // US Digital site.
00273 
00274             char v_t[BUFFER_SIZE], v_1[BUFFER_SIZE], v_2[BUFFER_SIZE], v_3[BUFFER_SIZE],
00275                         v_4[BUFFER_SIZE], v_5[BUFFER_SIZE], v_6[BUFFER_SIZE];
00276             char temp_t[BUFFER_SIZE], temp_1[BUFFER_SIZE], temp_2[BUFFER_SIZE],
00277                         temp_3[BUFFER_SIZE], temp_4[BUFFER_SIZE], temp_5[BUFFER_SIZE],
00278                         temp_6[BUFFER_SIZE];
00279             return;
00280 }
00281 
00282 // *************************************************
00283 //
00284 //  General flow of operation:
00285 //   1. Open the port and configure it.
00286 //      The QSB UART wants 230.4K Baud, 8-n-1
00287 //   2. Set up the QSB to read an encoder.
00288 //   3. Loop polling and printing the current
00289 //      encoder count.
00290 //   4. Upon close request, close the port and
00291 //      exit.
00292 //
00293 // *************************************************
00294 
00295 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00296 {
00297         double danger_Temp = 150;
00298         double warning_temp = 130;
00299         double loop = .25;
00300     std::string port = SERIAL_PORT;
00301     // Register the Ctrl-C handler.
00302     signal(SIGINT, ctrlCHandler);
00303 
00304     ros::init(argc, argv, "BatteryManager");
00305     ros::NodeHandle n;
00306 
00307     ros::param::get("~Danger_Temp",danger_Temp);
00308     ros::param::get("~Warning_Temp",warning_temp);
00309     ros::param::get("~Loop_Rate",loop);
00310     ros::param::get("~Port",port);
00311 
00312     ros::Publisher batteryPublisher = n.advertise<oryx_msgs::Battery>("Battery",6);
00313     ros::Publisher temperaturePublisher = n.advertise<oryx_msgs::Temperature>("Temps",15);
00314 
00315     ros::Rate loopRate(loop);
00316 
00317     configureBMS(port);
00318 
00319     while (n.ok())
00320        {
00321 
00322 
00323         oryx_msgs::Battery batteryMsg;
00324         oryx_msgs::Temperature temperatureMsg;
00325 
00326         temperatureMsg.warning_Temp = warning_temp;
00327         temperatureMsg.danger_Temp = danger_Temp;
00328 
00329                 batteryMsg.node=0;
00330                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(0);
00331                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=17;
00332                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(0);
00333                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00334                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00335 
00336                 batteryMsg.node=1;
00337                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(1);
00338                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=18;
00339                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(1);
00340                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00341                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00342 
00343                 batteryMsg.node=2;
00344                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(2);
00345                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=19;
00346                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(2);
00347                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00348                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00349 
00350                 batteryMsg.node=3;
00351                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(3);
00352                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=20;
00353                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(3);
00354                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00355                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00356 
00357                 batteryMsg.node=4;
00358                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(4);
00359                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=21;
00360                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(4);
00361                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00362                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00363 
00364                 batteryMsg.node=5;
00365                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(5);
00366                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=22;
00367                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(5);
00368                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00369                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00370 
00371                 batteryMsg.node=6;
00372                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(6);
00373                 temperatureMsg.temperature_node=23;
00374                 temperatureMsg.temperature=getTemperature(6);
00375                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00376                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00377 
00378                 batteryMsg.node=7;
00379                 batteryMsg.voltage=getVoltage(7);
00380                 if(batteryMsg.voltage >0)batteryPublisher.publish(batteryMsg);
00381                 if(temperatureMsg.temperature > 0) temperaturePublisher.publish(temperatureMsg);
00382                 ros::spinOnce();
00383 
00384                 loopRate.sleep();
00385 
00386        }
00387 
00388     close(bms);
00389     //puts("\n");
00390     return(0);
00391 }
